SELECT i.*, b.*, a.apply_id FROM resume r JOIN person p ON r.MID = p.MID JOIN apply a ON r.RESUME_ID = a.RESUME_ID JOIN info i ON a.JID = i.JID LEFT JOIN business b ON i.MID = b.MID WHERE r.MID = #{mid}
SELECT count(*) FROM resume r JOIN person p ON r.MID = p.MID JOIN apply a ON r.RESUME_ID = a.RESUME_ID JOIN info i ON a.JID = i.JID LEFT JOIN business b ON i.MID = b.MID WHERE a.JID = #{jid}
select count(*) from apply join resume using (resume_id) where mid = #{mid}

SELECT AVG(qualification_count) AS average_qualification_count FROM ( SELECT COUNT(q.qualification_id) AS qualification_count FROM apply a JOIN resume r ON a.resume_id = r.resume_id LEFT JOIN qualification q ON r.resume_id = q.resume_id WHERE a.jid = #{jid} GROUP BY a.jid, r.resume_id )

SELECT AVG(education_count) AS average_education_count FROM ( SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT e.resume_id) AS education_count FROM apply a JOIN resume r ON a.resume_id = r.resume_id LEFT JOIN education e ON r.resume_id = e.resume_id WHERE a.jid = #{jid} AND e.school_name LIKE '%대학%' )

SELECT AVG(experience_count) AS average_experience_count FROM ( SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT r.resume_id) AS experience_count FROM apply a JOIN resume r ON a.resume_id = r.resume_id LEFT JOIN experience e ON r.resume_id = e.resume_id WHERE a.jid = #{jid} GROUP BY a.jid, r.resume_id )
